Other significant mental health complaints in Rule out depression or other MNS conditions people exposed to extreme stressors Assess if the person is seeking help to relieve symptoms or has considerable difficulty with daily functioning Assess if the person has been exposed to FOLLOW-UP extreme stressors Assess if there is imminent risk of self-harm/suicide Ass O e T ss H m 1 e nt Assessment COMMON PRESENTATIONS OF OTHER SIGNIFICANT MENTAL HEALTH COMPLAINTS F eeling extremely tired, depressed, irritated, anxious or stressed. M edically unexplained somatic complaints (i.e. somatic symptoms that do not have a known physical cause that fully explains the symptom). 1 Is there a physical cause that fully explains the presenting symptoms? Manage any physical cause identified and recheck to see if the symptoms persist. 2 Is this depression or another MNS condition discussed in another module of this guide? Go to relevant module.
